TopicTitle: Can't Collect Science Through Science Tools

Articles.Content:
I've downloaded a set of mods (the most I can from; Here)

This is what my game is reading that I have, and you can see my KSP version:

But my problem is that when I try to right click a science pod or anything during a flight or simulation, no gui appears so I can't collect science through any of my instruments.  The only way I can collect science is through contracts and if I right click any command module, being crewed or non-crewed, I can do "Analyze Telemetry".  Does anyone have any reasoning with what could be preventing me from using science tools or even doing a crew report with these mods?
Step 1 - update the mods showing that there are updates available.

I would guess that it's mod-related.  You have a bunch of mods installed, some of which affect the behavior of the stock game.  It could be a deliberate design feature, or it could be a bug in the mod (if that's what it is).

If you right-click on a science instrument, you should get a menu.  If you're not getting that, something's wrong.

Here's a simple, easy, and quick diagnostic check:

  1. Run "clean" KSP with no mods installed.  Start a career game, launch a ship with a science instrument, right-click on the instrument.  Do you get a menu?
  2. DItto exactly the above, but with all your mods installed.  Same or different result?

If your answer is "Yes, it's working fine in case #1, but broken in case #2", then that means one of your mods is causing the problem, and all you have to do is figure out which one.  Try adding the mods one at a time to the "clean" game, and see how far you get until it breaks.

Then you'll know which mod it is, and you can go post in that mod's thread for help.

It's definitely a mod. "Analyze telemetry" is not a stock option. I'm not sure which of the mods on your list it is, as I haven't used several of them. You'll have to do 1 by 1 unless you can remember which mod mentioned something about telemetry.
After messing around with some files, somehow in the realistic progression mod (RP-0), some file got moved into a weird location so I moved it back and it works fine.
